recipe.title: How to Make Chicken Nanban
recipe.intro: Chicken Nanban is fried chicken with sweet vinegar sauce and tartar sauce. It comes from Miyazaki in Japan.
recipe.ingredients: chicken thigh, salt, pepper, flour, egg, vegetable oil, soy sauce, sugar, rice vinegar, mayonnaise, boiled egg, onion, pickle
steps: **Cut** the chicken into big pieces and add salt and pepper.
**Cover** the chicken with flour and then dip it in beaten egg.
**Fry** the chicken in hot oil until it is golden brown.
**Make** the sweet vinegar sauce by mixing soy sauce, sugar, and rice vinegar in a small pot.
**Put** the fried chicken into the sweet vinegar sauce for one minute.
**Make** tartar sauce by mixing mayonnaise, chopped boiled egg, onion, and pickle, and put it on top of the chicken. **Enjoy!**

review.content: I went to Mountain View Dining at Mount Coot-tha in Brisbane. The view from the window was amazing. I could see the city and the mountains. I ate Chicken Nanban and it was so good. The chicken was crispy and the tartar sauce was rich and creamy. The sweet vinegar sauce was a little sour and very nice. The restaurant had warm lights and a cozy feeling. There were lavender flowers on each table. I loved this place very much.

australia_tips.title: オーストラリアでチキン南蛮を作るなら
australia_tips.content:
チキン南蛮に必要な材料は、ほぼオーストラリアのスーパーでそろいます。米酢（rice vinegar）はアジア食材コーナーにあります。なければ、白ワインビネガー（white wine vinegar）で代用できます。ピクルスは「pickles」や「gherkins」として瓶詰めで売られています。

ブリスベンのMount Coot-tha（マウントクーサ）は、市内から車で15分ほどの展望スポットです。山の上からブリスベンの街並みが一望でき、夜景もきれいです。展望台の近くにはカフェもあり、景色を眺めながらゆっくりお茶ができます。

チキン南蛮はボリュームがあるので、ワーホリ中の食事にぴったりです。たくさん作って翌日のお弁当にするのもいいですね。タルタルソースは多めに作って冷蔵庫に入れておくと、サンドイッチにも使えて便利です。

Mount Coot-thaにはボタニカルガーデン（植物園）もあり、季節の花が楽しめます。ジャスミンやミモザの花も見られることがあります。休みの日にお弁当を持ってピクニックするのもおすすめです。ブリスベンは気候が良く、一年を通して外での食事が楽しめます。

conversation.scene: シェアハウスで友人のSophieにチキン南蛮を作ってあげた場面

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Sophie, dinner is ready! I made Chicken Nanban.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Wow, it looks great! What is the white sauce on top?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: That is tartar sauce. I made it with egg and mayonnaise.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: And what about this brown sauce?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: That is sweet vinegar sauce. It is a little sweet and a little sour.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Interesting! Let me try... Oh, this is so good!

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Really? I am glad you like it.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: The chicken is so crispy. And the two sauces go well together.

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: Thank you! This dish is from Miyazaki. It is a famous place in Japan.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: I did not know that. Is Miyazaki near Tokyo?

lines.speaker: A
lines.text: No, it is in the south of Japan. It is warm there, like Brisbane.

lines.speaker: B
lines.text: Nice! Can you teach me how to make it next time?
